metadata.Title: CVE-2017-1000409 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
A buffer overflow in glibc 2.5 (released on September 29, 2006) and can be triggered through the LD_LIBRARY_PATH environment variable. Please note that many versions of glibc are not vulnerable to this issue if patched for CVE-2017-1000366.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-1000409` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

eglibc-source - 2.19-0ubuntu6.14
libc-bin - 2.19-0ubuntu6.14
libc6 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.14
libc6-amd64 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.14
libc6-armel - 2.19-0ubuntu6.14
libc6-i386 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.14
libc6-pic - 2.19-0ubuntu6.14
libc6-ppc64 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.14
libc6-prof - 2.19-0ubuntu6.14
libc6-x32 - 2.19-0ubuntu6.14
multiarch-support - 2.19-0ubuntu6.14
nscd - 2.19-0ubuntu6.14
No subscription required

criterions.comment: eglibc package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.19-0ubuntu6.14').
